abstract: Questions about Zilmax, a feed additive made by Merck, show the market dangers of an increasingly complicated global food chain, Kevin Allison of Reuters Breakingviews writes.
snippet: Questions about Zilmax, a feed additive made by Merck, show the market dangers of an increasingly complicated global food chain, Kevin Allison of Reuters Breakingviews writes.
lead_paragraph: Animal medicine, whether for livestock or pets, is a booming business. Pfizer’s recent spinoff, Zoetis, trades at a large valuation premium to traditional drug makers, for example.

headline.main: The Risks of Investing in Animal Medicine
